description.narrative:
To contribute to the reduction of morbidity and mortality related to undernutrition amongst boys and girls under five years and women of reproductive age in West Pokot County.
1. To enhance decision making, planning and resources allocation for nutrition at the community and county levels through evidence based advocacy and communication. 2. To strengthen capacity of local partners and health care staff to provide high impact nutrition interventions (HiNi) with enhanced coverage. 3. To enhance adoption of optimal Maternal Infant and Young Child Nutrition (MIYCN) practices through community based approaches. 4. To enhance nutrition data management and quality assurance for timely and effective decision making. 5. To enhance nutrition resilience through capacity enhancement and partnerships.

activity-date.narrative: Actual end date of the activity
Actual start date of the activity
